intro: Polyscias multijuga, commonly known as the broadleaf sycamore, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by orange-red berries. Polyscias multijuga is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
